DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to prove whether general anesthesia combined with epidural anesthesia could better maintain body balance of Th1/Th2 and Treg/Th17 compared with general anesthesia, so as to reduce the surgical stress-related immunosuppression, and to improve the prognosis.
DOC.brief_title: General Anesthesia Combined With Epidural Anesthesia Mitigates the Surgical Stress-related Immunosuppression in Patients With Colorectal Cancer
DOC.criteria: patients with Colorectal Cancer(CRC); subjected to the FastTrack processing of surgery; between 18 and 75 years old. American Society of Anesthesiologists(ASA) grade > III; BMI > 30; a history of abdominal surgery, endocrine or immune system dysfunction; recent blood transfusions, hormone or nonsteroidal antiinflammatory therapy during the past month; previous contraindication to epidural anesthesia.
